feedback.Physical Object: Included — A bounded, wearable audio device with defined shape.
feedback.Synthetic: Included — Manufactured from plastic, metal, and electronic components.
feedback.Biological/Biomimetic: Included — Leverages a biological principle: bone conduction.
feedback.Powered: Included — Requires battery or external power to operate.
feedback.Structural: Included — Form factor designed to hold shape and transmit vibration.
feedback.Observable: Included — Perceivable visually and by touch.
feedback.Active: Included — Engages in vibration and sound output during operation.
feedback.Intentionally Designed: Included — Created for direct human use and sensory experience.
feedback.Outputs Effect: Included — Emits vibration-based sound as its main effect.
feedback.Processes Signals/Logic: Included — Converts digital/analog signals to mechanical motion.
feedback.State-Transforming: Included — Has dynamic power modes, volume, and connectivity states.
feedback.Human-Interactive: Included — Worn, operated, and controlled by humans.
feedback.System-integrated: Included — Links with external systems like phones or computers.
feedback.Functionally Autonomous: Included — Operates independently once powered (e.g., standalone listening).
feedback.System-Essential: Excluded — Can be swapped or removed from systems without compromising function.
feedback.Symbolic: Excluded — Not used to represent anything abstract.
feedback.Signalling: Included — Transmits structured auditory information (speech, music).
feedback.Rule-governed: Excluded — Not an abstract rule-based system.
feedback.Compositional: Excluded — Modular in hardware but not semantically abstract.
feedback.Social Construct: Excluded — Materially exists independent of social categorization.
feedback.Identity-Linked: Excluded — Not inherently tied to identity.
feedback.Regulated: Excluded — May be regulated in practice, but not intrinsically defined by regulation.
feedback.Economically Significant: Included — Commercially produced and marketed globally.
feedback.Ethically Significant: Included — Involves accessibility, inclusion, and design ethics.

encoding_notes: This encoding captures the bone conduction headset as a multisensory, powered, biologically-informed communication device. It includes social traits only where tied directly to ethical and market relevance. Final UHT code and trait labeling fully conform to the UHT v2 standard.
